勞.definition: (bound form) to toil; labor; (bound form) laborer; (bound form) meritorious deed; (bound form) fatigue; to put sb to the trouble (of doing sth); to express one's appreciation (Taiwan pr. [lao4])

勞傷.definition: disorder of internal organs caused by overexertion

勞力.definition: labor; able-bodied worker; laborer; work force

勞動人民.definition: working people; the workers of Socialist theory or of the glorious Chinese past

勞動合同.definition: labor contract; contract between employer and employees governing wages and conditions

勞動新聞.definition: Rodong Sinmun (Workers' news), the official newspaper of the North Korean WPK's Central Committee

勞動營.definition: labor camp; prison camp with hard labor

勞務.definition: service (work done for money); services (as in "goods and services")

勞務人員.definition: laborer; service worker (typically employed on a contractual or temporary basis)

勞勞叨叨.definition: variant of 嘮嘮叨叨|唠唠叨叨[lao2 lao5 dao1 dao1]

勞委會.definition: labor committee; abbr. for 勞動委員會|劳动委员会

勞役.definition: forced labor; corvée (labor required of a serf); animal labor

勞心.definition: to work with one's brains; to rack one's brains; to worry

勞心勞力.definition: to tax one's mind and body; demanding (work); dedicated (worker); hard-working

勞心苦思.definition: to rack one's brains; to think hard

勞改.definition: abbr. for 勞動改造|劳动改造[lao2 dong4 gai3 zao4]; reform through labor; laogai (prison camp)

勞方.definition: labor (as opposed to capital or management); the workers

勞煩.definition: to inconvenience; to trouble (sb with a request)

勞燕分飛.definition: the shrike and the swallow fly in different directions (idiom); (usually of a couple) to part from each other

勞神.definition: to be a tax on (one's mind); to bother; to trouble; to be concerned

勞累.definition: tired; exhausted; worn out; to toil

勞而無功.definition: to work hard while accomplishing little; to toil to no avail

勞資.definition: labor and capital; workers and capitalists

勞資關係.definition: industrial relations; relations between labor and capital

勞逸結合.definition: to strike a balance between work and rest (idiom)

勞雇關係.definition: relations between labor and employer; industrial relations
